BLOC1.PART1: A university education of excellence provided in a network of 20 MBIs delivering a licence and a Master MBI.
BLOC1.PART2:
A national steering around two reference frameworks:

One "training" harmonizes the entire teaching programme,
The other "professional" - European - defines the skills associated with the different target professions of MIAGE.
BLOC1.PART3:
MBI is :
  • chevron_rightAt the national level: 4000 students, 1300 alternates, 1200 Master's graduates
  • chevron_rightIn Toulouse: 200 students, 100 alternates, 60 Master's graduates

BLOC2.TITRE: A wide range of sectors of activity and companies
BLOC2.PART1:
All types of companies (large groups, SMEs, VSEs, public services and local authorities, associations) in all professional sectors are concerned by the activities targeted by graduates:
  • chevron_rightDigital service companies
  • chevron_rightGoods- and service-producing industries
  • chevron_rightBanks and insurance companies
  • chevron_rightDistribution, transport and tourism companies...
  • chevron_rightHealth and human assistance organizations
  • chevron_rightGovernment, regional, local, government ministries and agencies...
BLOC2.PART2: The professions in the digital sector are currently facing a recruitment deficit at regional, national and European level.

BLOC3.PART1: The hiring salaries of Master graduates are over €30k for more than 90% of them. Integration rates are close to 100% within 3 months after graduation.
BLOC3.PART2:
Since 2009 :
  • chevron_right2 to 3 graduates per year start up companies
  • chevron_right6 graduates entered the doctoral school during this period
  • chevron_rightThe very short integration periods are directly linked to the activity in the Occitan Region, which remains the preferred place for our graduates to integrate.
  • chevron_rightNew trends have emerged: first experience abroad (VIE...), year of break of discovery abroad (Canada, Australia, New Zealand)
